attributes.comment:
I am stunned to hear that the USCIS is considering significant fee increases for
families involved in the adoption process. As my daughter, wife, and I wait for our
daughter from China, we have had to be fingerprinted twice and submit our I-600A
twice as well. It is expensive enough already to bring a new baby into our home;
fee increases by a federal agency will only make that even more so. Perhaps the
better solution to an increase in fees would be to increase the amount of time that
fingerprints and the I-171-H are valid! That would mean fewer applications for the
USCIS to handle and less expense for adoptive families. A win-win situation for
both parties.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Lawrence M. Tjeltveit
